articles.title: FIIs withdraw Rs 4.4 lakh crore from equities in 16 months. Why they are quitting, what should retail inve - Economic Times
articles.description: The massive vacuum created by the withdrawals of FIIs has been partially filled by domestic institutional investors. They have purchased equities worth almost Rs.3.68 lakh cr in the past 16 months.

articles.description: On Saturday, Housing Development Finance Corp (HDFC), India's largest mortgage financier, hiked its benchmark retail prime lending rate (RPLR) for the fifth time this fiscal ahead of the RBI's monetary policy meeting scheduled on August 5.
